title: typstcv
text:
Data Column Formatter



format_date(
  data,
  start = "start",
  end = NULL,
  sep = " - ",
  date_format = "%M %Y",
  colname_date = "date",
  replace_na = "Present",
  sort_by = "none",
  decreasing = TRUE
)







data


Data frame for resume entry




start


Start date column name. Default is "start"




end


Optional. End date column name.




sep


Separator between start and end date. Default is " - "




date_format


Date format. Default is "%M %Y"




colname_date


Name for the generated date column. Default is "date"




replace_na


Value to replace NA values. Default is "Present"




sort_by


Sort by "none", "start" or "end". Default is "none"




decreasing


Sort in decreasing order. Default is TRUE






Data frame with formatted date column




library(typstcv)

work |>
  format_date(end = "end", date_format = "%Y", sort_by = "start") |>
  resume_entry()

```{=typst}
#resume-entry(title: "Associate Professor",location: "Zürich, Switzerland",date: "1909 - 1911",description: "University of Zürich",)
#resume-entry(title: "Junior Professor",location: "Bern, Switzerland",date: "1908 - 1909",description: "University of Bern",)
#resume-entry(title: "Technical Assistant",location: "Bern, Switzerland",date: "1902 - 1908",description: "Federal Patent Office",)
```

data-raw/data.R

title: typstcv
text:
Convert a data frame to a resume entry



resume_entry(
  data,
  title = "title",
  location = "location",
  date = "date",
  description = "description"
)







data


A data frame with columns for title, location, date, and description




title


The column name for the title. Default is "title"




location


The column name for the location. Default is "location"




date


The column name for the date. Default is "date"




description


The column name for the description. Default is "description"






A string with the resume entry




library(typstcv)

educ <- data.frame(
 title = c("Ph.D. in Physics", "Master of Science"),
 location = c("Zürich, Switzerland", "Zürich, Switzerland"),
 date = c("1905", "1896 - 1900"),
 description = c("University of Zürich", "ETH")
)

resume_entry(educ)

```{=typst}
#resume-entry(title: "Ph.D. in Physics",location: "Zürich, Switzerland",date: "1905",description: "University of Zürich",)
#resume-entry(title: "Master of Science",location: "Zürich, Switzerland",date: "1896 - 1900",description: "ETH",)
```

title: typstcv
text:
Convert a data frame to a resume entry



resume_entry(
  data,
  title = "title",
  location = "location",
  date = "date",
  description = "description"
)







data


A data frame with columns for title, location, date, and description




title


The column name for the title. Default is "title"




location


The column name for the location. Default is "location"




date


The column name for the date. Default is "date"




description


The column name for the description. Default is "description"






A string with the resume entry




library(typstcv)

educ <- data.frame(
 title = c("Ph.D. in Physics", "Master of Science"),
 location = c("Zürich, Switzerland", "Zürich, Switzerland"),
 date = c("1905", "1896 - 1900"),
 description = c("University of Zürich", "ETH")
)

resume_entry(educ)

```{=typst}
#resume-entry(title: "Ph.D. in Physics",location: "Zürich, Switzerland",date: "1905",description: "University of Zürich",)
#resume-entry(title: "Master of Science",location: "Zürich, Switzerland",date: "1896 - 1900",description: "ETH",)
```

title: typstcv
text:
This package provides helper functinons for kazuyanagimoto/quarto-awesomecv-typst. This work are inspired by these three works:

Byungjin Park’s Awesome-CV

A beautiful LaTeX template of CV

Paul Tsouchlos’s modern-cv

A Typst implementation of Awesome-CV

Mitchell O’Hara-Wild and Rob Hyndman’s vitae

R package for modern CV, including Awesome-CV




You can install the development version of typstcv from R-universe with:
install.packages("typstcv", repos = "https://kazuyanagimoto.r-universe.dev")



You can find a simple example and qmd code.


You can use the template with quarto command.
quarto use template kazuyanagimoto/quarto-awesomecv-typst



Set author information in YAML.
author:
  firstname: Albert
  lastname: Einstein
  address: "Rämistrasse 101, CH-8092 Zürich, Switzerland, Zürich"
  position: "Research Physicist・Professor"
  contacts:
    - icon: fa envelope
      text: ae@example.com
      url: "mailto:ae@example.com"
    - icon: PATH_TO_ICON/icon.svg
      text: example.com
      url: https://example.com

fontawesome icons are supported via duskmoon314/typst-fontawesome with fa prefix.
SVG icons can be used by specifying the path to the icon file




You can set fonts and the accent color in YAML.
style:
   color-accent: "516db0"
   font-header: "Roboto"
   font-text: "Source Sans Pro"
format:
  awesomecv-typst:
    font-paths: ["PATH_TO_FONT"]



resume_entry() is a helper function to create resume entryies from a data frame.
educ |>
  resume_entry(
    title = "title",
    location = "location",
    date = "year",
    description = "detail"
)



date_formatter() is a helper function to format dates in the resume.
work |>
  format_date(
    start = "date_start",
    end = "date_end",
    date_format = "%Y",
    sep = "->",
    sort_by = "start"
  ) |>
  resume_entry()

title: typstcv
text:
You can install the development version of typstcv from R-universe with:
install.packages("typstcv", repos = "https://kazuyanagimoto.r-universe.dev")

title: typstcv
text:
You can find a simple example and qmd code.


You can use the template with quarto command.
quarto use template kazuyanagimoto/quarto-awesomecv-typst



Set author information in YAML.
author:
  firstname: Albert
  lastname: Einstein
  address: "Rämistrasse 101, CH-8092 Zürich, Switzerland, Zürich"
  position: "Research Physicist・Professor"
  contacts:
    - icon: fa envelope
      text: ae@example.com
      url: "mailto:ae@example.com"
    - icon: PATH_TO_ICON/icon.svg
      text: example.com
      url: https://example.com

fontawesome icons are supported via duskmoon314/typst-fontawesome with fa prefix.
SVG icons can be used by specifying the path to the icon file




You can set fonts and the accent color in YAML.
style:
   color-accent: "516db0"
   font-header: "Roboto"
   font-text: "Source Sans Pro"
format:
  awesomecv-typst:
    font-paths: ["PATH_TO_FONT"]



resume_entry() is a helper function to create resume entryies from a data frame.
educ |>
  resume_entry(
    title = "title",
    location = "location",
    date = "year",
    description = "detail"
)



date_formatter() is a helper function to format dates in the resume.
work |>
  format_date(
    start = "date_start",
    end = "date_end",
    date_format = "%Y",
    sep = "->",
    sort_by = "start"
  ) |>
  resume_entry()

title: Citation
text:
Citation
To cite package ‘typstcv’ in publications use:

  Yanagimoto K (????). _typstcv: CV for Quarto & Typst_. R package
  version 0.0.0.9001, https://kazuyanagimoto/typstcv/,
  <https://github.com/kazuyanagimoto/typstcv>.

A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is

  @Manual{,
    title = {typstcv: CV for Quarto & Typst},
    author = {Kazuharu Yanagimoto},
    note = {R package version 0.0.0.9001, 
https://kazuyanagimoto/typstcv/},
    url = {https://github.com/kazuyanagimoto/typstcv},
  }
